state.description: Alabama offers free tuition at the following 2-year public colleges if you are over 60 years old.

schools.name: Enterprise-Ozark Community College
schools.description: Space in desired classes must be available, and the waiver only applies to tuition.

schools.name: Lawson State Community College
schools.description: Waivers are for college credit courses only.

schools.name: Lurleen B. Wallace Community College
schools.description: Waivers are for college credit courses only.

schools.name: Northwest Shoals Community College
schools.address: 800 George Wallace Blvd, Muscle Shoals, Alabama 35661

schools.name: Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Alabama, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: Permanent residents of Alaska who are eligible for full Social Security benefits may receive free tuition at the following public colleges and universities in the state.

schools.name: Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Alaska, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: Arizona residents who live in Cochise or Santa Cruz counties who are over 60 years old may be eligible for discounted tuition at Cochise College.

schools.name: Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Arizona, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in California, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

schools.name: Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.address: One Ferry Building, San Francisco CA 94111

state.description: Colorado residents have a few schools they can attend for free or for a discount, depending on their age. Take a look at the following options.

schools.name: Colorado State University
schools.address: 7800 East Orchard Road Ste 200, Greenwood Village, Colorado 80111-0000
schools.description: If you are at least 55 years old, you may attend resident instruction classes for free if there is room.

schools.name: University of Colorado Boulder
schools.address: Regent Drive at Broadway, Boulder, Colorado 80309-0017
schools.description: If you are at least 55 years old, you may audit classes for a $25 fee per term if there is room.

schools.name: University of Colorado Denver
schools.address: 1380 Lawrence Street, Lawrence Street Center, Suite 1400, Denver, Colorado 80217-3364
schools.description: Area residents at least 60 years old may audit classes for free.

schools.name: University of Northern Colorado
schools.description: Individuals at least 65 years old may audit classes tuition free, but course fees may apply. Courses for credit may receive a reduced tuition rate.

schools.name: Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Colorado, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description:
The following Connecticut State University schools offer Connecticut residents who are at least 62 years old access to tuition-free courses in degree-granting programs, as well as a waiver of the university and extension fees.

In addition, the Connecticut community colleges listed below allow Connecticut residents who are at least 62 years old to enroll in classes for free on a space-available basis.

schools.name: University of Connecticut
schools.description: Connecticut residents who are at least 62 years old may audit undergraduate classes in the fall and spring for $15.

schools.name: Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Connecticut, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: Delaware citizens who are at least 60 years old can attend classes for free—other than the cost of books, supplies, laboratory fees, and shop fees—on a space-available basis at the following schools. learn more

schools.name: Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Delaware, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: Residents of the District of Columbia who are at least 65 years old can attend classes in the Institute of Gerontology at the University of the District of Columbia with a tuition and fees waiver.

schools.name: University of the District of Columbia
schools.address: 4200 Connecticut Ave NW, Washington, District of Columbia 20008

schools.name: Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Washington, D.C., to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: The following Florida state universities may waive tuition and fees for Florida residents who at least 60 years old; however, students may not receive credit for the classes when the tuition is waived. It is up to each university to permit these waivers. learn more.

schools.name: Florida Atlantic University
schools.description: This school has the largest adult continuing education program in the United States, serving over 19,000 senior citizens.

schools.name: Florida Gulf Coast University
schools.address: 10501 Fgcu Blvd S, Fort Myers, Florida 33965-6565

schools.name: Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Florida, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: The following colleges and universities may allow Georgia residents who are at least 62 years old to attend school tuition free on a space-available basis. learn more.

schools.name: Fort Valley State University
schools.address: 1005 State University Dr, Fort Valley, Georgia 31030-4313

schools.name: South Georgia State College
schools.address: 100 W College Park Dr, Douglas, Georgia 31533

schools.name: Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Georgia, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: Hawaii residents who are at least 60 years old can take classes for free through the Senior Citizen Visitor Program at the following schools; however, credit will not be awarded for these classes.

schools.name: University of Hawaii Kauai Community College
University of Hawaii Manoa
schools.address: 2500 Campus Road, Hawaii Hall, Honolulu, Hawaii 96822-2217

schools.name: Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Hawaii, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: The following public colleges and universities offer discounted tuition and fees to Idaho residents who are at least 60 years old. Take a look at the details below.

schools.name: Boise State University
schools.description: Seniors may pay only $5 per credit hour, a $20 registration fee per semester, and any special fees associated with their classes. This is on a space-available basis.

schools.name: College of Southern Idaho
schools.description: Seniors may obtain a Gold Card, which allows them to take credit classes tuition free; however, fees still apply. The students must be non-degree seeking.

schools.name: College of Western Idaho
schools.description: Seniors may receive a 50% reduction of in-state tuition costs. Non-residents at least 60 years old may receive 50% off non-resident tuition costs.

schools.name: Idaho State University
schools.description: Seniors may pay $20 per semester plus $5 per credit hour to attend classes, as well as any class or professional fees associated with their courses.

schools.name: Lewis Clark State College
schools.description: Seniors may pay $20 per semester registration fee plus $5 per credit hour on a space-available basis, with a maximum of six credits per semester or three credits in the summer sessions.

schools.name: North Idaho College
schools.description: Non-degree seeking students may attend non-degree credit classes for $25 per class plus $5 per credit.

schools.name: Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Idaho to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: The following colleges and universities of Illinois offer older students the ability to enroll tuition free on a space-available basis. learn more.

schools.name: Carl Sandburg College
schools.address: 2400 Tom L Wilson Boulevard, Galesburg IL 61401

schools.name: College of Lake County
schools.address: 19351 W WASHINGTON S, Grays Lake IL 60030

schools.name: East St. Louis Community College Center
Northeastern Illinois University
schools.address: 5500 NORTH SAINT LOUIS AVENUE, Chicago IL 60625

schools.name: South Suburban College
schools.address: 15800 SOUTH STATE ST, South Holland IL 60473

schools.name: Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Illinois, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: Indiana residents who are at least 60 years old and retired may pay 50% off the resident tuition rate for classes at the following schools on a space-available basis. The colleges can restrict students to 9 semester hours per semester using this benefit. learn more.

schools.name: Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Indiana, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: Iowa residents have a couple schools that offer free tuition or discounts to senior citizens. Take a look at the following options.

schools.name: Eastern Iowa Community Colleges
schools.description: Offers continuing education programs and classes for seniors for free or a nominal cost.

schools.name: North Iowa Area Community College
schools.description: Offers a Lifelong Learning Institute for $99 a year, which provides classes, lectures, social events, and civic engagement opportunities to seniors.

schools.name: Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Iowa, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: Kansas residents who are at least 60 years old may be able to audit classes at specific schools. Take a look at the following options.

schools.name: Emporia State University
schools.description: Kansas residents who at least 60 years old may audit classes for free on a space-available basis.

schools.name: University of Kansas
schools.description: Kansas residents who are at least 60 years old may audit classes for free with a tuition waiver. Only non-degree seeking students are eligible, and they are limited to 6 hours of enrollment per semester.

schools.name: Washburn University
schools.description: Resident students who are at least 60 years old may audit classes on a space-available basis without paying tuition, university fees, or activities fees.

schools.name: Wichita State University
schools.description: Kansas residents who are at least 60 years old may audit regular lecture and some group activity courses on a space-available basis without paying tuition.  Others fees may still apply.

schools.name: Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Kansas, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: Kentucky residents who are at least 65 years old may have their tuition and fees waived at the following schools on a space-available basis. learn more.

schools.name: Kentucky Community and Technical College System
Northern Kentucky University
schools.address: 416 ADMIN CENTER, Nunn Drive, Highland HTS KY 41076

schools.name: Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Kentucky, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: Some Louisiana public colleges and universities waive tuition and fees, as well as reduce the costs of books and required supplies by 50%, for students who are at least 55 years old (though most require students to be at least 60 years old). learn more.

schools.name: Nichols State University
schools.description: A tuition and registration fee waiver is available for up to three credits per semester to any student at least 60 years old.

schools.name: Northwestern State University of Louisiana
schools.description: Students at least 60 years old may have eligible fees waived at the time of registration. The waiver is limited to three credits per semester.

schools.name: Southeastern Louisiana University
schools.description: Louisiana residents at least 60 years old are not charged general fees for up to three credits.

schools.name: Southern University at New Orleans
schools.description: The Golden Scholars Program waives tuition and fees for Louisiana residents who are at least 62 years old.

schools.name: University of Louisiana at Lafayette
schools.description: Tuition exemption is available for students who are at least 60 years old and enroll in three credit hours or less per semester. These students will still be responsible for other fees.

schools.name: University of Louisiana at Monroe
schools.description: A Sixty and Over Fee Waiver is available to students at least 60 years old for up to three credits per semester. These students will still be responsible for other fees.

schools.name: University of New Orleans
schools.address: ADMINISTRATION BUILDING Room 1005, New Orleans LA 70148
schools.description: All applicants at least 65 years old are eligible for the Golden Ager Scholarship, which covers tuition, but not fees.

schools.name: Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Louisiana, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: If space is available, Maine citizens who are at least 65 years old can have tuition and board-approved mandatory fees waived for undergraduate courses for credit or audit at the following schools. learn more.

schools.name: University of Maine at Fort Kent
University of Maine at Presque Isle
Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Maine, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: Maryland residents who are at least 60 years old, retired, whose chief income comes from retirement benefits, and are not employed full time may enroll in up to three credits per semester or term for free on a space-available basis at Maryland system schools. It is up to the college or university to determine the availability of this waiver. Other institutions in Maryland also grant waivers to older borrowers as well. learn more.

schools.name: Anne Arundel Community College
schools.description: Waives tuition charges for credit and continuing education classes for Maryland residents who are at least 60 years old. All other fees must be paid.

schools.name: Baltimore City Community College
schools.description: Maryland residents who are at least 60 years old may attend credit courses tuition free with a $20 administrative fee. Non-credit courses have a $10 fee.  All other fees assessed with courses would be applied as well.

schools.name: Chesapeake College
schools.description: Maryland residents who are at least 60 years old may enroll tuition free in co-listed courses starting 2 weeks prior to the start of the semester. Enrollment prior to this date will incur the full tuition charge. These students will be responsible for all other fees. Most continuing education courses are tuition free at any time for these students.

schools.name: College of Southern Maryland
schools.description: On a space-available basis, waives tuition for Maryland residents who are at least 60 years old for credit courses.

schools.name: The Community College of Baltimore County
schools.description: Waives tuition for Maryland residents who are at least 60 years old.

schools.name: Frederick Community College
schools.description: Certain courses may have their tuition charges waived for Maryland residents who are at least 60 years old.

schools.name: Garrett College
schools.description: Maryland residents who are at least 60 years old can take non-credit courses tuition free.

schools.name: Harford Community College
schools.description: State-supported courses are tuition free for Maryland residents who are at least 60 years old on a space-available basis.

schools.name: Howard Community College
schools.description: Waives tuition for Maryland residents at least 60 years old.

schools.name: Montgomery College
schools.description: Non-credit courses may have their tuition charges waived for Maryland residents who are at least 60 years old.

schools.name: St. Marys College of Maryland
schools.description: The Senior Citizen Tuition Waiver is available to students who are at least 60 years old, retired, whose chief income is from retirement benefits, and are not employed full time.

schools.name: University of Maryland Center for Environmental Science
University System of Maryland at Hagerstown
Wor-Wic Community College
schools.description: Waives tuition for Maryland residents who are at least 60 years old for credit classes.

schools.name: Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Maryland, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: Tuition may be waived for Massachusetts residents over age 60 at the following schools. learn more.

schools.name: The Massachusetts College of Art and Design
The Massachusetts College of Liberal Arts
Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Massachusetts, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: Michigan residents who are at least 60 years old may have their tuition waived at specific schools. Take a look at the following options

schools.name: Alpena Community College
schools.description: College district residents at least 65 years old receive a full-tuition waiver on the first day of classes but are responsible for all other fees.

schools.name: Central Michigan University
schools.description: Michigan residents at least 60 years old may audit classes at no charge.

schools.name: Gogebic Community College
schools.description: Gogebic country residents at least 60 years old may take credit courses without being charged tuition if there is space-available in the class.

schools.name: Kalamazoo Valley Community College
schools.description: Admitted students who are at least 60 years old and reside in-district may receive a full tuition waiver if space is available the week before the class begins.

schools.name: Kirtland Community College
schools.description: Michigan residents at least 60 years old may receive a tuition waiver for up to three credits per semester. This waiver is only offered when it is fiscally possible.

schools.name: Lake Michigan College
schools.description: In-district residents at least 60 years old qualify for tuition-free enrollment in college credited courses.

schools.name: Lake Superior State University
schools.description: Undergraduate courses may be audited tuition free by Michigan residents at least 60 years old if there is space available in the class.

schools.name: Lansing Community College
schools.description: Residents of the LCC district for six months prior to the beginning of the semester who are at least 62 years old qualify for a reduced tuition rate of $43 per billing hour on classes. Other Michigan residents that meet the age requirement get a reduced rate of $85 per billing hour on classes. Classes can be for audit or credit.

schools.name: Macomb Community College
schools.description: Students at least 60 years old receive a 10% reduction in tuition.

schools.name: Michigan Technological University
schools.description: Up to two on campus courses per semester may be available free of tuition to students who are at least 60 years old.

schools.name: Monroe County Community College
schools.description: A Senior Citizen Scholarship is offered to Monroe County residents who are at least 60 years old. This scholarship reduces tuition by 50%.

schools.name: Mott Community College
schools.description: District residents who are at least 60 years old may have their tuition charges reduced by 50% on a space-available basis.

schools.name: Muskegon Community College
schools.description: Muskegon County residents at least 60 years old may enroll in the Study Opportunities for Adult and Mature Citizens program. Tuition for this program is waived for both audited and for credit courses.

schools.name: North Central Community College
schools.description: Emmet County residents at least 60 years old will be granted tuition-free enrollment on a space-available basis.

schools.name: Northern Michigan University
schools.description: Application fees are waived for students at least 62 years old.

schools.name: Oakland Community College
schools.description: Michigan residents at least 60 years old may receive a 20% discount on tuition.

schools.name: Schoolcraft College
schools.description: Students who are at least 60 years old may receive a tuition reduction of 50% off the resident tuition rate. For Continuing Education and Professional Development classes, the reduced course fees are specified per course.

schools.name: Wayne County Community College
schools.description: District residents who are at least 60 years old may enroll tuition free.

schools.name: Wayne State University
schools.description: Students at least 60 years old receive a 75% reduction in tuition for undergraduate classes. All other fees must be paid.

schools.name: West Shore Community College
schools.description: College district residents who are at least 60 years old will receive a full-tuition waiver.

schools.name: Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Michigan, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: Minnesota residents may attend credit courses, audit courses, or enroll in any non-credit courses without paying tuition or activity fees at the following schools on a space-available basis. learn more.

schools.name: Fond du Lac Tribal and Community College
Mesabi Range Community and Technical College
Minnesota West Community and Technical College
St Cloud Technical and Community College
Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Minnesota, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: Some Mississippi institutions offer free or reduced tuition or fees for students who are at least 60 years old. Take a look at the following options.

schools.name: Mississippi State University
schools.description: Mississippi residents over 60 years old may enroll tuition free in up to two courses per semester at the Starksville or Meridian campuses in the Center for Distance Education.

schools.name: Hinds Community College
schools.description: Students who are at least 65 years old may receive a full tuition waiver for both audited and for-credit classes.

schools.name: Jones County Junior College
schools.description: Students over 65 years old may enroll in courses without paying for registration or general fees, but they must pay lab fees.

schools.name: University of Mississippi
schools.description: Students who are at least 65 years old may enroll in one course tuition free as a Lifelong Learner.

schools.name: Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Mississippi, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: Residents of Missouri who are at least 65 years old on or before August 1 of a school year may receive a full tuition scholarship at the following schools on a space-available basis. Classes cannot be taken for credit, and registration fees are limited to $25. learn more.

schools.name: Missouri University of Science and Technology

state.description: The Montana University system allows in-state residents who are at least 65 years old to receive a full-tuition waiver at the following schools. learn more.

schools.name: Bitterroot College of The University of Montana
City College of Montana State University Billings
Flathead Valley Community College
schools.address: MAIN CAMPUS 777 Grandview Drive Kalispell, MT 59901

schools.name: Great Falls College Montana State University
Montana Tech of the University of Montana
Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Montana, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: Nebraska residents have a couple schools that may allow them to audit classes for free or receive a tuition discount. Take a look at the following options.

schools.name: Chadron State College
schools.description: Students who are at least 65 years old may audit classes tuition free.

schools.name: Metropolitan Community College
schools.description: Nebraska residents who are at least 62 years old get 50% off tuition charges per credit hour.

schools.name: Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Nebraska, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: Students who are at least 62 years old may apply for the Senior Sunshine Fund at Truckee Meadows Community College. This fund provides financial assistance to seniors so that they may participate in personal interest classes offered by the TMCC Workforce Development and Continuing Education Division.

schools.name: Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Nevada, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: Most public 4-year colleges and universities in New Hampshire offer a tuition waiver to state residents who are at least 65 years old. In addition, all of the community colleges in the Community College System of New Hampshire offer half-priced tuition to New Hampshire residents who are at least 65 years old on a space-available basis.

schools.name: Granite State College
schools.description: New Hampshire residents who are at least 65 years old and not enrolled in a degree program may attend classes for free on a space-available basis.

schools.name: Plymouth State University
schools.description: Residents of New Hampshire who are at least 65 years old may receive a full tuition grant for one course per term if the student is not enrolled in a degree program.

schools.name: University of New Hampshire
schools.description: New Hampshire residents who are at least 65 years old and not enrolled in a degree program may take up to two credit-bearing courses per academic year tuition free.

schools.name: University of N.H. at Manchester
schools.description: Non-degree seeking residents of New Hampshire who are at least 65 years old are eligible to take a maximum of two credit-bearing courses per academic year tuition free.

schools.name: Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in New Hampshire, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: Most public colleges and universities in New Jersey offer tuition waivers or discounts to older students. Take a look at the following options learn more.

schools.name: Atlantic Cape Community College
schools.description: Anyone who is at least 65 years old may enroll tuition free in credit courses on a space-available basis.

schools.name: The College of New Jersey
schools.description: Students who are at least 65 years old and enrolled in a degree program may attend tuition free. The number of students admitted using this senior citizen waiver cannot exceed 1% of the total undergraduate enrollment.

schools.name: Cumberland County College
schools.description: Cumberland county residents who are at least 60 years old may enroll in classes tuition free on a space-available basis.

schools.name: Mercer County Community College
schools.description: Mercer county residents who are at least 65 years old may enroll in classes at a reduced rate on a space-available basis.

schools.name: Middlesex County College
schools.description: Middlesex county residents who are at least 65 years old may take courses on a space-available basis tuition free.

schools.name: New Jersey City University
schools.description: Students who are at least 65 years old may enroll in credit and non-credit classes tuition free.

schools.name: Ocean County College
schools.description: Eligible Ocean county senior residents may enroll in college credit courses on a space-available basis at a reduced rate.

schools.name: Passaic County Community College
schools.description: Passaic county residents who are at least 60 years old who wish to audit courses only have to pay $5 in tuition per course, or they may attend credit courses tuition free on a space-available basis.

schools.name: Ramapo College of New Jersey
schools.description: New Jersey residents who are at least 65 years old may enroll in credit or non-credit classes on a space-available basis tuition free. There are restrictions to when these students may register.

schools.name: Raritan Valley Community College
schools.description: Hunterdon/Somerset County Gold Card Senior Citizens may attend by only paying fees on a space-available basis.

schools.name: Richard Stockton College of New Jersey
schools.description: Students who are at least 65 years old who have been residents of New Jersey for the 12 months prior to enrollment may have their tuition waived on a space-available basis.

schools.name: Rowan College at Gloucester County
schools.description: Older students may call the Gloucester County Department of Senior Services to receive an Aging Golden Certificate Pass, which will allow them to receive reduced tuition for credit courses on a space-available basis.

schools.name: Rutgers University
schools.description: The Senior Citizen Audit Program allows retired New Jersey residents who are at least 62 years old to attend classes on a space-available, noncredit basis.

schools.name: Salem Community College
schools.description: Salem County residents who are at least 60 years old may enroll in credit courses without paying tuition charges, application, or registration fees on a space-available basis no earlier than the first day of classes.

schools.name: Seton Hall University
schools.description: Students who are at least 65 years old may audit summer classes for $45 per course or take summer classes for credit for $145 per course.

schools.name: Sussex County Community College
schools.description: Sussex county residents who are at least 65 years old are entitled to free tuition for college-level courses if enrolled in the final 2 business days before the start of the semester.

schools.name: Union County College
schools.description: Older students may receive a tuition and/or fee waiver to attend classes.

schools.name: William Paterson University
schools.description: New Jersey residents who are at least 65 years old are eligible to enroll in undergraduate courses on a non-credit basis tuition free.

schools.name: Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in New Jersey, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: Anyone who is at least 65 years old may receive reduced tuition to the following New Mexico public colleges and universities by request. The tuition will be $5 per credit hour. learn more.

schools.name: New Mexico Institute of Mining & Technology
New Mexico State University  Dona Ana
University of New Mexico  Los Alamos
Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in New Mexico, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: New York residents who are at least 60 years old may be able to audit classes or receive reduced tuition at certain schools. Take a look at the following options

schools.name: Binghamton University
schools.description: New York residents who are at least 60 years old may audit classes tuition free but may incur fees.

schools.name: The City University of New York
schools.description: Residents of New York who are at least 60 years old may audit undergraduate classes at CUNY institutions without a tuition charge on a space-available basis.

schools.name: Clinton Community College
schools.description: Students who are at least 60 years old may audit courses tuition free on a space-available basis.

schools.name: Cornell University
schools.description: Students who are at least 60 years old may attend certain summer classes on a non-credit basis for free.

schools.name: Dowling College
schools.description: Students who are at least 62 years old may audit courses for $114 per credit.

schools.name: Dutchess Community College
schools.description: Students who are at least 60 years old may audit courses on a space-available basis without being charged tuition fees.

schools.name: Farmingdale State College
schools.description: Students who are at least 60 years old may audit one class in the fall and spring semesters for free on a space-available basis.

schools.name: Fulton-Montgomery Community College
schools.description: New York state residents who are at least 60 years old may audit credit courses free of charge on a space-available basis.

schools.name: Hofstra University
schools.description: Students who are at least 60 years old may receive 50% off tuition for credit courses.

schools.name: Hudson Valley Community College
schools.description: Students who are at least 60 years old may audit courses tuition free.

schools.name: Long Island University
schools.description: Students who are over the age of 65 may enroll in undergraduate or graduate courses at LIU Post or LIU Brentwood for 50% off the tuition cost for credit courses or 75% off non-credit courses.

schools.name: Mohawk Valley Community College
schools.description: Oneida County residents who are at least 60 years old may sign up to audit classes tuition free on a space-available basis.

schools.name: Monroe Community College
schools.description: Residents who are at least 60 years old may audit courses tuition free on a space-available basis tuition free.

schools.name: New York Institute of Technology
schools.description: Students who are at least 65 years old receive a discount on tuition for graduate and undergraduate courses.

schools.name: Niagara County Community College
schools.description: Students who are at least 60 years old may audit classes free of charge.

schools.name: Onondaga Community College
schools.description: Students who are at least 60 years old may audit classes free of charge on a space-available basis.

schools.name: Purchase College
schools.description: New York residents who are at least 60 years old may enroll tuition free to audit up to two courses each semester. Other fees will apply.

schools.name: State University of New York at Canton
schools.description: Students who are at least 60 years old may audit up to two classes per term for free.

schools.name: Sullivan County Community College
schools.description: Seniors who are at least 60 years old can audit up to two courses per term tuition free, but they must pay fees.

schools.name: Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in New York, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in North Carolina, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in North Dakota, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

The following schools allow Ohio residents who are at least 60 years old to attend classes for free on a space-available basis. It is up to the school to determine if these students may receive credit for the classes or not. learn more.

schools.name: University of Rio Grande Community College
Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Ohio, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: Oklahoma residents who are at least 65 years old may audit classes with a tuition and fees waiver on a space-available basis at the following schools. learn more.

schools.name: Oklahoma State University Center for Health Sciences
Oklahoma State University Institute of Technology
University of Oklahoma Health Sciences Center
University of Science and Arts of Oklahoma
Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Oklahoma, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: Many community colleges and 4-year institutions in Oregon offer tuition waivers or discounts to older students. Take a look at the following options.

schools.name: Blue Mountain Community College
schools.description: Oregon residents who are at least 62 years old get a 50% reduction in the resident tuition rate for credit classes and will not be charged tuition for audited classes.

schools.name: Chemeketa Community College
schools.description: Oregon residents who are at least 65 years old may receive a tuition waiver on a space-available basis for lower-division collegiate credit courses.

schools.name: Clatsop Community College
schools.description: Oregon residents who are at least 65 years old may register to audit lower-division collegiate courses with a tuition waiver. Students who are at least 62 years old will receive a 25% discount on tuition and instructional fees as well.

schools.name: Klamath Community College
schools.description: Oregon residents who are at least 65 years old who have a current term application on file may receive a full tuition waiver to audit up to eight credits per term on a space-available basis.

schools.name: Linn-Benton Community College
schools.description: Oregon residents who are at least 65 years old may audit up to eight credits of lower division classes per term tuition free. Anyone at least 62 years old will only be charged 75% of the tuition rate.

schools.name: Mount Hood Community College
schools.description: In-district residents who are at least 62 years old will receive a 50% discount on tuition. Oregon residents who are at least 65 years old may audit lower level collegiate courses without being charged tuition on a space-available basis. Many non-credit continuing education classes are offered to seniors who are at least 62 years old at a discount.

schools.name: Oregon Institute of Technology
schools.description: Students who are at least 65 years old may audit classes on a space-available basis with no instruction fees.

schools.name: Oregon State University
schools.description: Students who are at least 65 years old and auditing classes are charged for special materials only.

schools.name: Portland Community College
schools.description: Oregon residents who are at least 62 years old receive a 50% discount on Community Education Classes, but this excludes fees.

schools.name: Treasure Valley Community College
schools.description: Oregon residents who are at least 60 years old may enroll and receive a 50% discount on tuition for most classes on a space-available basis. Video, Web-based, CBWCL courses or contract out-of-district programs are not eligible.

schools.name: Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Oregon, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: Many schools in Pennsylvania offer tuition waivers or reductions to older students. Take a look at the following options.

schools.name: Bucks County Community College
schools.description: Bucks county residents who are at least 65 years old may enroll tuition free in credit courses on a space-available basis.

schools.name: Butler County Community College
schools.description: Butler county residents who are at least 62 years old may enroll in credit classes on a space-available basis without paying tuition, required fees, or an application fee.

schools.name: Community College of Allegheny County
schools.description: Allegheny county residents who are at least 65 years old may enroll in up to two credit courses each semester without incurring tuition charges.

schools.name: Community College of Beaver County
schools.description: Pennsylvania residents who are at least 65 years old receive a highly reduced tuition rate for credit classes; in addition, tuition is waived for specific non-credit courses on a space-available basis.

schools.name: Community College of Philadelphia
schools.description: Philadelphia residents who are at least 65 years old can register for up to one credit course tuition free per semester on a space-available basis.

schools.name: East Stroudsburg University
schools.description: Pennsylvania residents who are at least 60 years old and retired may enroll in up to six credits per semester in a non-degree status.

schools.name: Edinboro University
schools.description: Students who are at least 62 years old who are receiving Social Security benefits or the equivalent retirement benefits may receive full tuition.

schools.name: Indiana University of Pennsylvania
schools.description: Students receiving Social Security or equivalent retirement benefits do not have to pay basic fees for audit classes when space is available.

schools.name: Luzerne County Community College
schools.description: Students who are at least 62 years old may enroll in credit courses without incurring a tuition charge on a space-available basis. Luzerne county residents will only be charged general services fee, the technology fee per credit, and any other course fees. Additional fees apply to non-residents.

schools.name: Mansfield University
schools.description: Pennsylvania residents who are at least 62 years old and are receiving Social Security retirement benefits may enroll in undergraduate classes tuition free.

schools.name: Millersville University
schools.description: Any part-time, non-degree student who is at least 62 years old may audit one course per semester or session without being charged tuition on a space-available basis.

schools.name: Northampton Community College
schools.description: In-county residents who are at least 65 years old qualify for a tuition and fee waiver for credit courses.

schools.name: Reading Area Community College
schools.description: Berks county citizens who are at least 65 years old may take one course per semester tuition free on a space-available basis.

schools.name: Shippensburg University
schools.description: Retired Pennsylvania residents who are at least 60 years old may have all tuition charges and fees waivedexcept the Educational Service fee and Technology feefor any undergraduate program on a space-available basis.

schools.name: Slippery Rock University
schools.description: Students who are at least 62 years old who are on Social Security or equivalent retirement benefits may attend classes for credit tuition free or may audit classes tuition and fee free. Individuals who meet the age requirements are also eligible if they can show proof that they are not working but are not eligible for Social Security benefits based on their previous work or are deferring receiving their benefits.
schools.url: https://www.sru.edu/academics/enrollment/AcademicRecords/Documents/ARSS Forms/Senior Citizen Application to Take Class.pdf

schools.name: West Chester University
schools.description: Retired Pennsylvania residents may attend tuition free on a space-available basis.

schools.name: Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Pennsylvania, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: Tuition waivers are available at the following Rhode Island schools for students who are at least 60 years old, disabled veterans, members of the National Guard, or unemployed. learn more.

schools.name: Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Rhode Island, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: South Carolina residents who are at least 60 years old may attend credit or non-credit classes on a space-available basis without having to pay tuition at the following schools. learn more.

schools.name: Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in South Carolina, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: South Dakota residents who are at least 65 years old will receive a 75% reduction in tuition for undergraduate or graduate coursework at four-year South Dakota-supported state universities.

schools.name: South Dakota School of Mines and Technology

state.description: Tennessee residents who are at least 60 years old may audit courses at the following schools without paying tuition, maintenance fees, and student activity fees on a space-available basis. Residents who are at least 65 years old may enroll in for-credit courses at these schools without paying tuition, maintenance fees, student activity fees, and registration fees. learn more.

schools.name: University of Tennessee Health Science Center
Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Tennessee, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: Texas public colleges and universities enrolled in the Senior Citizen Tuition Reduction Plan allow students who are at least 55 years old to take classes on a space-available basis at a significant discount or free of tuition. learn more.

schools.name: Sul Ross State University Rio Grande College
University of North Texas Dallas College of Law
Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Texas, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: Utah residents who are at least 62 years old may audit classes on a space-available basis in the following schools without regular tuition charges. learn more.

schools.name: Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Utah, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: Vermont citizens who are at least 65 years old are eligible for a tuition waiver for up to two courses per enrollment period at the following schools, if the student is a non-degree seeking student. learn more.

schools.name: Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Vermont, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: Virginia residents who are at least 60 years old may take college courses without paying tuition at the following schools as a full-time or part-time student for academic credit if their federal taxable income does not exceed $15,000 per year. Virginian residents who are at least 60 years old—regardless of income—may audit courses at these schools without paying tuition, but they may have to pay for course materials and laboratory fees. learn more.

schools.name: University of Virginias College at Wise
Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Virginia, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: Residents of the U.S. Virgin Islands who are at least 60 years old may enroll free of charge at the University of the Virgin Islands.

Washington residents who are at least 60 years old may enroll at the following schools for up to two courses per term for credit or noncredit and have tuition charges waived or partially waived. learn more.

schools.name: Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Washington, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: West Virginia residents who are at least 65 years old may receive reduced tuition and fees at the following schools. learn more.

schools.name: Potomac State College of West Virginia University
West Virginia School of Osteopathic Medicine
West Virginia University Institute of Technology
Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in West Virginia, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: Wisconsin residents who are at least 62 years old or are at least 60 years old and receive a railroad retirement annuity may enroll in courses at the following schools without having to pay tuition or activity fees on a space-available basis. Minimal administrative fees will apply only to for-credit courses. learn more.

schools.name: Lac Courte Oreilles Ojibwa Community College
Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Wisconsin, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.

state.description: Wyoming residents who are at least 60 years old may be able to take advantage of reduced or free tuition at certain schools. Take a look at the following options.

schools.name: Central Wyoming College
schools.description: Wyoming residents of Fremont County who are at least 60 years old pay no tuition if they complete a tuition grant request; however, they are responsible for fees.

schools.name: Laramie County Community College
schools.description: Students who are at least 60 years old receive a tuition discount, allowing them to enroll for $10 per credit plus all course fees and/or online fees.

schools.name: University of Wyoming
schools.description: Wyoming residents who are at least 65 years old and admitted to the school may enroll on a space-available basis at no cost.

schools.name: Western Wyoming Community College
schools.description: Wyoming residents who are at least 65 years old taking courses within Sweetwater County may have their tuition and adult education fees waived.

schools.name: Osher Lifelong Learning Institutes
schools.description: The Bernard Osher Foundation has partnered with 119 campuses across the country, including in Wyoming, to offer a diverse collection of non-credit programs for adults over 50 years old. These programs are offered free of charge at participating schools.
